main

Class ClackClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.ClackClient

  • public class ClackClient
extends java.lang.Object
    ClackClient represents the client who is using the service. Contains information about the client, host computer that is the server, port, connection status, and data to be sent and received.
    Author:
    Gabriella Zhalov

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int FIXED_PORT 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClackClient()
      default constructor for ClackClient sets the username to 'Anon', hostname to 'localhost', and port to 7000 using previous constructors
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName)
      tertiary constructor for ClackClient Takes in the username of the client, sets the hostname and port to a default value
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName)
      secondary constructor for ClackClient Takes in a username and hostname, but sets the port to a default value
      ClackClient(java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String hostName, int port)
      main constructor for ClackClient Takes in the username of the client, the hostname of the server computer, and port number.

      • ClackClient

        public ClackClient(java.lang.String userName,
                   java.lang.String hostName,
                   int port)
        main constructor for ClackClient Takes in the username of the client, the hostname of the server computer, and port number.
        Parameters:
        userName - username of client
        hostName - name of computer that is hosting the server
        port - port number to access

      • ClackClient
